chargeHist.descr: Battery to School District Officers, etc

result.execSummary:
The defendant Demonte L Hamler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution set at zero.
Court costs and victim witness surcharges payable during term of probation.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
DNA surcharge not applicable as this offense occurred before April 1, 2015.  Mandatory DNA surcharge and assessments to be paid during term of probation. Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have part time job; if defendant is in school part time to have a full time job.
Obtain GED or HSED.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No contact with Joseph S.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
Court expungment if defendant successfully completes probation.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Letter of apology to Joseph S.  Defendant to submit leter to agent who will forward letter to Joseph S.  Letter must be done by 9/17/2015.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: To report on June 26, 2015.  Huber release privileges for work and/or school.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) ad

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to the amended charge and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 10 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of  1 YEAR with the following conditions:
-Restitution set at $0
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges payable during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-DNA surcharges not applicable as this offense occurred before April 1, 2015.  Mandatory DNA surcharges and assessments to be paid during term of probation; non payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses  or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job; if defendant is in school part-time, defendant to have a full-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-No contact with Joseph S.
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Defendant to perform 20 hours of community service for a non-profit
-Letter of apology to Joseph S.  Defendant to submit letter to agent who will forward letter to Joseph S.  Letter must be done by 9/17/2015
-As a condition of probation, defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work and/or school.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on June 26, 2015
-Court expungment if defendant successfully completes probation

Defendant Demonte L Hamler in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Original Amended Information received and filed.  Defense waives reading of the Amended Information and enters a plea of not guilty.

Defendant not in court, in custody, appears by his attorney Valeria Taylor.  Michael J. Lonski appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court sets bail in the amount of $200.00 cash TOT Justice Point for supervision with same previous conditions.
Email sent to Attorney Val Taylor informing her that her client has been picked up on the warrant that was issued on 4/14/15.  Matter set for Return on Warrant.

Justice Point Discharge Summary, received and filed.
*defendant in warrant status*

The court ordered any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody for Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Calendar Call.  Defendant not present.  Statement made by defense.  On state's motion the court lifts stay, Bench Warrant Issued.

Matter calendared for Scheduling conference.  Defendant has failed to appear.  Justice Point violation filed on 3-19-15 not addressed by the Court.  
Bench Warrant issued but stayed until 4-15-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Calendar call scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial, received and filed.

Defendant Demonte L Hamler in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Ron Dague for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
